That's amazing! It sounds like you're really dedicated to improving your dance skills, and setting up a mini dance studio in your living room is a great way to practice regularly. Having a mirror and a Bluetooth speaker can really help you to focus on your technique and get a feel for the music.

Pirouettes and jazz turns can be challenging, but with consistent practice, you'll get the hang of them! It's great that you're focusing on perfecting these skills, as they're essential in many different dance styles.

Here are a few tips that might help you with your pirouettes and jazz turns:

* Make sure you're standing with proper posture and alignment, with your weight evenly distributed between both feet. This will help you to maintain balance and control as you turn.
* Keep your core engaged and your arms relaxed, with a soft, gentle movement. Avoid stiffening up or tensing your muscles, as this can throw you off balance.
* Focus on spotting, which means keeping your eyes focused on a fixed point in front of you as you turn. This will help you to maintain your orientation and prevent dizziness.
* Practice turning in both directions, as this will help you to develop balance and control.
* Start with slower, smaller turns and gradually increase your speed and size as you become more comfortable.
* Remember to breathe and relax – it's okay to make mistakes, and the more you practice, the more comfortable you'll become.

For jazz turns, you can also try practicing with a partner or using a chair or wall for support. This can help you to build confidence and get a feel for the movement.

Keep up the great work, and don't be afraid to experiment and try new things! Remember to stretch before and after practice, and to listen to your body and take breaks when needed.

How do you feel about recording yourself dancing and watching the video to improve your technique? Sometimes, seeing yourself from an outside perspective can help you to identify areas for improvement and develop your skills more quickly.
